marg LOCAL marg

NAME

mjo_arg_free, mjo_arg_malloc — allocate or release a mjo_arg_t memory resource

SYNOPSIS

#include <marg.h>

void
mjo_arg_free(mjo_arg_t *const io_obj);

void
mjo_arg_malloc(mjo_arg_t *const o_obj, enum mjo_arg_rule_mask const i_mask);

DESCRIPTION

mjo_arg_free() release a mjo_arg_t memory resource.

mjo_arg_malloc() allocate a mjo_arg_t memory resource.

Following is a description of the arguments.

o_obj
pointer to ‘mjo_arg_t *’ that shall be set to the address of a newly created memory resource
io_obj
pointer to a ‘mjo_arg_t *’ that shall be an address of a previously allocated memory resource
i_mask
rules that control the behavior of the parser
Release Resource
If both io_obj and *io_obj is not nil, any internal resources held by the object will be released. Following, mjo_free(3) shall be invoked on io_obj.
Allocate Resource
mjo_malloc(3) shall be invoked to create a mjo_arg_t object followed by allocation of any internal resources.

If io_obj is nil, it shall be denoted as an invalid argument.

If i_block is nil, *io_obj shall be set to nil and it shall be denoted as an invalid argument.

enum mjo_arg_rule_mask

mjo_arg_rule_mask_on_error_keep_going on error keep processing
mjo_arg_rule_mask_on_error_suppress_message do not print error diagnostics

RETURN VALUES

If any of the arguments are invalid, errno shall be set to EINVAL.

SEE ALSO

mjo_malloc(3) mjo_free(3)

November 25, 2021 OpenBSD 7.0
